name: sync::rcu::non_null::either::remove_bits

core::ptr::NonNull::<T>::addr.doc:
Gets the "address" portion of the pointer.

 For more details, see the equivalent method on a raw pointer, [`pointer::addr`].

 This is a [Strict Provenance][crate::ptr#strict-provenance] API.

core::num::NonZero::<T>::get.doc: Returns the contained value as a primitive type.

core::ptr::NonNull::<T>::map_addr.doc:
Creates a new pointer by mapping `self`'s address to a new one, preserving the
 [provenance][crate::ptr#provenance] of `self`.

 For more details, see the equivalent method on a raw pointer, [`pointer::map_addr`].

 This is a [Strict Provenance][crate::ptr#strict-provenance] API.

doc:
# Safety

 The caller must ensure that removing the bits from the non-null pointer will result in another
 non-null pointer.
